benchmark_details.name: PlanQA
benchmark_details.overview: PlanQA is a diagnostic benchmark for evaluating geometric and spatial reasoning in large-language models using structured representations of indoor scenes. It includes a dataset of 1,800 structured 2D layouts with 18,000 diverse questions to test various reasoning abilities.
benchmark_details.data_type: structured 2D layouts paired with natural language questions

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark for measuring spatial reasoning capabilities of language models in structured environments.

data.annotation: Questions generated based on structured layout parameters.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on relative error for numeric outputs and exact match for boolean outputs.
methodology.interpretation: Accuracy metrics are employed to gauge reasoning performance, with varying thresholds for question types.
methodology.validation: Models were evaluated in zero-shot conditions to ascertain the reasoned outputs based on structured input.
